Class Capsule

  • java.lang.Object
    • Capsule
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Capsule
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    An application capsule.

    This API is to be used by caplets (custom capsules) to programmatically (rather than declaratively) configure the capsule and possibly provide custom behavior.

    All non-final protected methods may be overridden by caplets. These methods will usually be called once, but they must be idempotent, i.e. if called numerous times they must always return the same value, and produce the same effect as if called once.
    Overridden methods need not be thread-safe, and are guaranteed to be called by a single thread at a time.
    Overridable (non-final) methods must never be called directly by caplet code, except by their overrides.

    Final methods implement various utility or accessors, which may be freely used by caplets.

    For command line option handling, see registerOption.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Capsule

        protected Capsule(Capsule pred)
        Caplets that will be listed on the manifest's Caplets attribute must use this constructor. Caplets are required to have a constructor with the same signature as this constructor, and pass their arguments to up to this constructor.
        Parameters:
        pred - The capsule preceding this one in the chain (caplets must not access the passed capsule in their constructor).

      • Capsule

        protected Capsule(java.nio.file.Path jarFile,
                  java.nio.file.Path cacheDir)
        Constructs a capsule.

        This constructor is used by a caplet that will be listed in the manifest's Main-Class attribute. Caplets are encouraged to "override" the other constructor so that they may be listed in the Caplets attribute.

        This constructor or that of a subclass must not make use of any registered capsule options, as they may not have been properly pre-processed yet.

        Parameters:
        jarFile - the path to the JAR file
        cacheDir - the path to the (shared) Capsule cache directory

      • buildProcess

        protected java.lang.ProcessBuilder buildProcess()
        Constructs a ProcessBuilder that is later used to launch the capsule. The returned process builder should contain the command minus the application arguments (which are later constructed by buildArgs and appended to the command).
        While environment variables may be set at this stage, the environment is later configured by buildEnvironmentVariables.

        This implementation tries to create a process running a startup script, and, if one has not been set, constructs a Java process.

        This method should be overridden to add new types of processes the capsule can launch (like, say, Python scripts). If all you want is to configure the returned ProcessBuilder, for example to set IO stream redirection, you should override prelaunch.

        Returns:
        a ProcessBuilder (must never be null).

      • buildSystemProperties

        protected java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> buildSystemProperties()
        Returns a map of system properties (property-value pairs).

      • chooseJavaHome

        protected java.nio.file.Path chooseJavaHome()
        Chooses which Java installation to use for running the app.
        Returns:
        the path of the Java installation to use for launching the app, or null if the current JVM is to be used.

      • chooseLogLevel

        protected int chooseLogLevel()
        Chooses and returns the capsules log level.

      • chooseMode

        protected java.lang.String chooseMode()
        Chooses this capsule's mode. The mode is chosen during the preparations for launch (not at construction time).

      • cleanup

        protected void cleanup()
        Called when the capsule exits after a successful or failed attempt to launch the application. If you override this method, you must make sure to call super.cleanup() even in the event of an abnormal termination (i.e. when an exception is thrown). This method must not throw any exceptions. All exceptions origination by cleanup must be wither ignored completely or printed to STDERR.

        protected static final int compareVersions(java.lang.String a,
                                           java.lang.String b)
        Compares two dotted software versions.
        Parameters:
        a - first version
        b - second version
        Returns:
        0 if a == b; > 0 if a > b; < 0 if a < b;

      • compareVersions

        protected static final int compareVersions(java.lang.String a,
                                           java.lang.String b,
                                           int n)
        Compares two dotted software versions, regarding only the first several version components.
        Parameters:
        a - first version
        b - second version
        n - the number of (most significant) components to consider
        Returns:
        0 if a == b; > 0 if a > b; < 0 if a < b;

      • exec

        protected static java.util.List<java.lang.String> exec(int numLines,
                                                       java.lang.ProcessBuilder pb)
                                                throws java.io.IOException
        Executes a command and returns its output as a list of lines. If the number of lines read is less than numLines, or if numLines < 0, then the method will wait for the child process to terminate, and throw an exception if the command returns an exit value != 0.
        Parameters:
        numLines - the maximum number of lines to read, or -1 for an unbounded number
        pb - the ProcessBuilder that will be used to launch the command
        Returns:
        the lines output by the command
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • exec

        protected static java.util.List<java.lang.String> exec(int numLines,
                                                       java.lang.String... cmd)

        Executes a command and returns its output as a list of lines. If the number of lines read is less than numLines, or if numLines < 0, then the method will wait for the child process to terminate, and throw an exception if the command returns an exit value != 0.
        Parameters:
        numLines - the maximum number of lines to read, or -1 for an unbounded number
        cmd - the command
        Returns:
        the lines output by the command
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • exec

        protected static java.util.List<java.lang.String> exec(java.lang.ProcessBuilder pb)
                                                throws java.io.IOException
        Executes a command and returns its output as a list of lines. The method will wait for the child process to terminate, and throw an exception if the command returns an exit value != 0.
        Same as calling exec(-1, pb}.
        Parameters:
        pb - the ProcessBuilder that will be used to launch the command
        Returns:
        the lines output by the command
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getMapAttribute

        protected final java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getMapAttribute(java.lang.String attr,
                                                                                 java.lang.String defaultValue)
        Returns the value of the given attribute (with consideration to the capsule's mode) as a map. The key-value pairs comprising attribute's value must be whitespace-separated, with each pair written as key=value.

        Same as parse(getAttribute(attr), defaultValue).

        Parameters:
        attr - the attribute
        defaultValue - a default value to use for keys without a value, or null if such an event should throw an exception

        Parameters:

      • parse

        protected static final java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parse(java.lang.String value,
                                                                              java.lang.String defaultValue)
        Parses an attribute's value string into an ordered map. The key-value pairs comprising string must be whitespace-separated, with each pair written as key=value.
        Parameters:
        value - the attribute's value
        defaultValue - a default value to use for keys without a value, or null if such an event should throw an exception

      • prelaunch

        protected java.lang.ProcessBuilder prelaunch(java.util.List<java.lang.String> args)
        Returns a configured ProcessBuilder that is later used to launch the capsule. The ProcessBuilder's IO redirection is left in its default settings. Caplets may override this method to display a message prior to launch, or to configure the process's IO streams. For more elaborate manipulation of the Capsule's launched process, consider overriding buildProcess.
        Parameters:
        args - the application command-line arguments
        Returns:
        a configured ProcessBuilder (if null, the launch will be aborted).

      • processOutgoingPath

        protected java.lang.String processOutgoingPath(java.nio.file.Path p)
        Every path emitted by the capsule to the app's command line, system properties or environment variables is first passed through this method. Caplets that relocate files should override it.
        Parameters:
        p - the path
        Returns:
        the processed path

      • registerOption

        protected static final void registerOption(java.lang.String optionName,
                                           java.lang.String methodName,
                                           java.lang.String defaultValue,
                                           java.lang.String description)
        Registers a capsule command-line option. Must be called in the caplet's static initializer.

        Capsule options are system properties beginning with the prefix ".capsule", normally passed to the capsule as -D flags on the command line.

        Options can be top-level *actions* (like print dependency tree or list JVMs), in which case the methodName argument must be the name of a method used to launch the action instead of launching the capsule.

        Options can have a default value, which will be automatically assigned to the system property if undefined. The default values "true" and "false" are treated specially. If one of them is the assigned default value, and the system property is defined with with a value of the empty string, then it will be re-assigned the value "true".

        Simple Command Line Options for Wrapper Capsules
        When the capsule serves as a wrapper (i.e. it's an empty capsule used to launch an executable artifact or another capsule) then the options can also be passed to the capsule as simple command line options (arguments starting with a hyphen), with the "capsule." prefix removed, and every '.' character replaced with a '-'.

        These command line arguments will automatically be converted to system properties, which will take their value from the argument following the option (i.e. -option value), unless the option is given one of the special default values "true" or "false", in which case it is treated as a flag with no arguments (note that an option with the default value "true" will therefore not be able to be turned off if simple options are used).

        Parameters:
        optionName - the name of the system property for the option; must begin with "capsule.".
        methodName - if non-null, then the option is a top-level action (like print dependency tree or list JVMs), and this is the method which will run the action. The method must accept a single args parameter of type List<String>.
        defaultValue - the option's default value ("true" and "false" are specially treated; see above).

      • systemProperty

        protected static final java.lang.String systemProperty(java.lang.String propName)
        Same as System.getProperty(propName) but sets context for error reporting.

      • testAppCacheUpToDate

        protected boolean testAppCacheUpToDate()
                                throws java.io.IOException
        Tests if the app cache is up to date. The app cache directory is obtained by calling getAppCache. This creates a file in the app cache, whose timestamp is compared with the capsule's JAR timestamp.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
